```{r, echo = FALSE}
expr <- function(s) (900)/(s^2+90*s+900)
x_zero <- c()
y_zero <- c()
x_pole <- c(-11.46,-78.54)
y_pole <- c(0,0)
pole_zero_plot(x_zero, y_zero, x_pole, y_pole, 100,expr,2)
```

$$
G(s) = \frac{900}{s^2+90*s+900}
$$

Denne funktion har polerne:

$$ 
p_1 = -11.46 \quad p_2 = -78.54\\
\sigma_1 = -11.46 \quad \sigma_2 = -78.54
$$

Dermed er det et *overdÃ¦mpet* respons:

$$ 
K_1 \cdot e^{-\sigma_1 t} + K_2 \cdot e^{-\sigma_2 t}
$$

Stepresponset bliver: 

$$ 
A + K_1 \cdot e^{-11.46 t} + K_2 \cdot e^{-78.54 t}
$$
